result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Schreiber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Denise K. or her residence.
Domestic Violence counseling.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Filed by State that no restitution has been requested and restitution be set at zero.
Restitution hearing at 10-21-2015 01:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Todd A Schreiber in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Form given to defendant for DNA Sample.  Court sets a restitution hearing. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 90 days jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution hearing set
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with Denise K. or her residence.  Domestic Violence Counseling.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 8/26/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court.   Defendant Todd A Schreiber did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense has received discovery and requests a date in 30 days for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
